content:
Netizen contribution
On May 10, the Nanjing Massacre Victims Memorial Hall official account announced that it had changed its name to the Nanjing Massacre Victims Memorial Hall, for unknown reasons.
According to the name change records, starting in 2017, the Nanjing Massacre Victims Memorial Hall has changed its name for two days every year at this time.

content:
Jiangyin shooting case police release follow-up
On May 10, the police found two male bodies and homemade guns under a cliff and confirmed that they were the suspects Chen and Geng.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Netizen contribution
As of now, Beijing bus cards still require real-name authentication before they can be recharged. In addition, real-name authentication is also required for on-site ticket purchases at Beijing subway stations.
This regulation was implemented in May 2022 as a basis for health code pop-ups and "epidemic investigations". However, it has been fully relaxed for half a year, but this restriction has not yet been lifted.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Netizen contribution
On May 11, the Party Committee Student Affairs Department of Henan Normal University issued an important reminder about wearing masks

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Netizen contribution
May 11, Shanghai.
Shanghai Pudong Development Bank employees went on strike, refusing to go to work after clocking in, sitting in protest at the door, and posting "Strike" on their workstations.
It is reported that the strike was caused by salary cuts.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Netizen contribution
"The Last Survivor"
On May 10, the True Story Project published an article about how a group of people who still adhere to strict epidemic prevention in China, which has been relaxed, live now.
Everyone gathered in the group chat, calling themselves "epidemic prevention nail households", and exchanged some daily epidemic prevention measures in the group and shared knowledge about the new coronavirus. There are about 60 people in the group, most of whom have not been infected with the new coronavirus so far, calling themselves "final round non-positive people". There are also a small number of "positive healthy people". Some people even changed their nicknames in the group to "super nail households".

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Pudong Development Bank responded that the pictures circulated online were two independent incidents. One was a strike by employees of a subsidiary due to salary issues. The other was a labor dispute between a business outsourcing company and its employees, which led to its employees going to Pudong Development Bank to protest. The relevant issues are currently being resolved.

Vivo and iQOO mobile phones have already connected the National Anti-Fraud Center to their OriginOS browsers.
A user found this confirmed in the mobile browser-settings-security center.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
May 11, Milan, Italy.
A van exploded and set surrounding vehicles on fire, causing 4 casualties according to media reports.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Netizen contribution
On May 11, the Network and Information Center of Southeast University sent an email to students on campus, saying that their unified authentication system account was logged in from a different location.
The webpage that was subsequently redirected said that this was just an "anti-phishing drill."
Such a prank-like behavior caused strong dissatisfaction among students. Some students questioned whether all official emails could not be trusted in the future if they could not even trust the warning emails sent by the school security center.
Another student said in the forum that the school website itself had many problems and bugs, and it would be better to solve these practical problems instead of playing pranks.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Coincidentally, in September last year, the University of Science and Technology of China also sent so-called "mooncake" phishing emails to 40,000 students across the school to conduct anti-phishing drills, which aroused public dissatisfaction at the time.
